results.secPara: Adam Lallana may miss a visit to his former club Southampton on Saturday because of the groin problem that forced him off in Englands draw against Spain.
results.webTitle: Liverpool waiting to assess whether Adam Lallana can face Southampton

results.secPara: In todays Fiver England, USA! USA!! USA!!!, Swindon, Mansfield and more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Yes, football was better in The Past

results.firPara: After two defeats, the US are struggling in World Cup qualifying and Jürgen Klinsmann is an isolated figure. At least Christian Pulisic looks good
results.secPara: For much of his first World Cup cycle, Jürgen Klinsmanns glass half-full approach seemed like a calming signal. But as his second cycle has stumbled from setback to mini-revival to bigger setback, his unwillingness to take responsibility looks to have made him an increasingly isolated figure.
results.webTitle: Ill-disciplined and ill-managed: a guide to USA's Costa Rica debacle

results.firPara: • Liverpool face Manchester City and Sunderland in New Year period
results.secPara: Liverpool will play two matches in under 46 hours over the New Year period after their request for a late kick-off at Sunderland was rejected by the Premier League.
results.webTitle: Liverpool fail in bid to avoid playing two matches in under 46 hours

results.firPara: Welcome back to club football, the sort that does not have to apologise for forcing viewers to wait an extra day for Im a Celebrity … Get Me Out of Here!. Events have been unfolding during the international break and it transpires that some Everton supporters think Ronald Koeman should be gagged. They do not care for the tone of some of the managers recent remarks and believe club officials should step in to shut him up next time he starts saying Romelu Lukaku probably will have to move somewhere else to fulfil his potential, or suggests Liverpool might be playing well enough to win the league.
results.secPara: Not all Everton fans are up in arms, it should be stressed, but a quick visit to the usual Merseyside platforms for football news and chat will reveal quite a few comments to the effect that Koeman has strayed beyond the pale. It appears characteristically Dutch outspokenness was fine when the topics for discussion were the underperforming Ross Barkley or the out-of-favour Oumar Niasse, but not so amusing when the subject changed to his own future – Koeman was rash enough to admit he would like to manage Holland one day – or the other lot from across Stanley Park.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman pokes hornets’ nest at Everton with uncomfortable truths | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: Featuring two cracking strikes from the Barcelona womens team, a brilliant finish that silenced Wembley and a return to form for Argentina against Colombia
results.secPara: Featuring two cracking strikes from the Barcelona womens team, a brilliant finish that silenced Wembley and a return to form for Argentina against Colombia
results.webTitle: The best goals of the week: Lionel Messi, Memphis Depay and Olga García

results.firPara: The former professional footballer, who is now 43, is finally able to talk publicly about the horrific abuse he suffered from the age of 11 by one of his coaches, in the hope that others will come forward too
results.secPara: It isnt easy sitting opposite Andy Woodward and hearing, close up, the unspeakable horrors of his childhood and the reasons why, at the age of 43, he finally feels able to tell his story and free himself from the secret – the massive, horrible burden – that has shaped his life.
results.webTitle: Andy Woodward: ‘It was the softer, weaker boys he targeted’

results.firPara: A hush is descending around Premier League grounds. Why has it come to this? Any explanation would have to start with money …
results.secPara: The Premier League returns this weekend and with it the question of which adjective describes the competition most accurately. Is it the best league in the world, the most competitive or simply the richest? One description often applied, perhaps because its suitably non-specific, is the most exciting league in the world. Step into a ground on match day, however, and you may be forgiven for doubting this was the case.
results.webTitle: Premier League must fight the tide of increasingly quiet crowds | Paul MacInnes

results.firPara: The Football League has broken off talks over a potential revamp of the pyramid under which it could have expanded to 80 teams and introduced a winter break.
results.secPara: A statement released by the EFL on Wednesday claimed that talks over the so-called whole game solution had stalled over the Football Associations refusal to move FA Cup matches to midweek.
results.webTitle: EFL talks over potential expansion stall due to disagreements with FA
